name: Sweet, Hot Mustard Slaw
author: Chef John
summary: I enjoy a wide variety of coleslaws, but this mustard slaw may be my fave. The combo of hot and sweet has a proven track record for pleasing palates. Salting and massaging your cabbage first (aka 'cassage') will help draw out water, which sweetens up the flavor, as well as produce a flexible, yet still crunchy texture, which I think is lacking in many other 'chop and mix' recipes. Garnished here with chives and chive blossoms.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon honey, or more to taste
½ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste
directions: Halve and quarter the head of cabbage and cut out the core
Place cabbage in a bowl and sprinkle in salt
Massage cabbage until it begins to soften, about 1 minute
Let rest for 10 minutes, tossing occasionally
Transfer cabbage to a colander and rinse well under cold water
Mix mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, grain mustard, honey, cayenne pepper, and vinegar together in a large bowl
Squeeze cabbage as dry as possible and add to the dressing
Cover top in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour
